title: Temporary driving licenses for tourists to be issued at BIA from today
byline: A new service counter for the issuance of necessary driving licenses to foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka for travel will be launched today (03) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) premises in Katunayake, Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Kamal Amarasinghe, stated.

title: Final Kumbal Perahera of Kandy Esala Festival to take to the streets tonight
byline: The fifth and final Kumbal Perahera of the Kandy Esala Festival is scheduled to parade the streets of Kandy tonight (03).

title: Cloudy skies, heavy showers expected in several areas today
byline: Cloudy skies can be expected over most parts of the island today (3), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: India on path to becoming third-largest economy, says Modi
byline: Asserting that India is on the path to becoming the world’s third-largest economy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday that the country must remain alert to its own economic priorities amid the instability and uncertainty facing the world economy.

title: Two Indians arrested with 8kg of ‘Kush’ cannabis at BIA
byline: Two Indian nationals have been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle around 8 kilograms of ‘Kush’ cannabis into the country.

title: Temporary driving licenses for tourists at BIA but no Tuk licenses, says DMT
byline: A new service counter for the issuance of necessary driving licenses to foreign nationals visiting Sri Lanka for travel will be launched today at the BIA premises in Katunayake, Commissioner General of Motor Traffic Kamal Amarasinghe, stated.

title: Grandson of former Indian PM Deve Gowda gets life sentence for rape
byline: A court in southern India has sentenced a prominent politician in the state of Karnataka to life in prison after being found guilty of raping one of his domestic staff.

title: Authorities urged to take action against foreigners engaged in business activities in Arugam Bay
byline: Israeli nationals arriving on tourist visas are having a significant impact on the tourism industry in the Arugam Bay area, according to local business owners.

title: One person injured in shooting incident reported in Matara
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Kapugama, Matara this morning (03), police stated.

title: Numerous issues have arisen due to delays in doctors’ transfers: GMOA
byline: Due to the actions of the Medical Services Unit of the Ministry of Health, serious issues have arisen concerning the transfers of over 23,000 doctors in Sri Lanka, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has stated.

title: Over 200,000 tourist arrivals recorded in July
byline: A total of 200,244 tourists arrived in the country in July 2025, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Iran fully reopens airspace after ceasefire with Israel
byline: Iran has lifted all remaining restrictions on its airspace that were imposed at the onset of its 12-day conflict with Israel, the country’s Civil Aviation Organization (CAO) has announced.

title: Tamil actor Madhan Bob passes away
byline: Veteran actor and comedian Madhan Bob, also known as Krishnamurthy, died at 71 in Chennai on Saturday (August 2).
